revised_title: Investigating Nuclear Relaxation Mechanisms in Viscous Solutions
tldr: This article explores the mechanisms of nuclear relaxation in fluids using linewidths in nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectra. The authors investigate relaxation processes in viscous solutions, finding that the dominant mechanism is intermolecular, not due to a dipolar field. They also demonstrate how the broadening patterns in NMR spectra can reveal relative signs of coupling constants, providing insights into relaxation mechanisms.
